title: What are the key principles of eco-conscious farming? eco-conscious farming best practices for

tasks.task: Riding a horse to cross a river.
subtasks: Sitting on the horse.
Holding the reins.
Monitoring river conditions.
Navigating the horse through the river.
Approaching the hay stack.
Lifting the hay bale.
Carrying the hay bale.
Placing the hay bale into the wagon.
Stopping the wagon near a barn or stable.
Lowering the hay bale from the wagon.
Removing the hay bale from the wagon.
Stacking the hay bale inside.

tasks.task: Driving a plow through a field.
subtasks: Attaching the plow to the tractor.
Operating the tractor to pull the plow.
Guiding the plow along the intended furrows.
Adjusting the plow depth as needed.
Loading the combine onto a trailer or truck.
Driving the combine through the wheat field.
Operating the combine's cutter bar and sieve.
Ensuring even crop coverage during harvesting.
Setting up the corn planter with seed packets.
Adjusting the planter's depth and spacing.
Manually loading corn seeds into the planter.
Walking behind the planter to consolidate rows.
Approaching the livestock enclosure.
Uncovering the feed trough.
Filling the trough with feed.
Observing the livestock for any signs of illness.

tasks.task: Gathering eggs from a chicken coop.
subtasks: Unlocking the chicken coop door.
Entering the coop carefully.
Collecting eggs from the nesting boxes.
Cleaning any soiled areas in the coop.
Selecting the right tree or log for posts.
Cutting the logs into appropriate lengths.
Splitting logs into thinner pieces if necessary.
Marking the posts at the correct height for placement.
Mixing paint according to the color desired.
Attaching a paintbrush or roller to a stick.
Climb a ladder to reach the barn's high walls.
Painting the walls in a systematic manner.
Leading the cattle to the feedlot.
Distributing feed to each animal.
Observing cattle eating patterns and animal health.
Removing uneaten or contaminated feed.
Inspecting the water source for the irrigation system.
Walking or driving to the irrigation system location.
Visiting each sprinkler or emitter to check for leaks or clogs.
Replacing faulty parts or clearing blockages.
Selecting an appropriate tiller or hoe.
Preparing the garden area by removing weeds and debris.
Plowing the soil to the desired depth.
Raking the surface to a smooth finish.
